intro: Pentapleura, commonly known as the five-leaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its simple, opposite, or whorled leaves, often with five lobes or segments. The flowers are typically small and clustered, with four to five petals and numerous stamens. The genus includes several species, some of which are found in tropical and subtropical regions. These plants are often used in traditional medicine and horticulture due to their ornamental value and potential medicinal properties.
